quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Autumn and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, birds, lakes. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Brightly colored foliage is the image most commonly associated with autumn. What region in the US is a popular leaf peeping tourist destination?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New England

questions.question: Which capital is not the largest city (by population) in its country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Washington, D. C. USA

questions.question: What English novelist and poet, best known for her book Wuthering Heights, wrote a poem containing the verses Every leaf speaks bliss to me/ fluttering from the autumn tree?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emily Bronte

questions.question: Which of these colors is not present in the national flag of Tanzania?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red

questions.question: In the Northern Hemisphere, autumn begins in September. When does it begin in the Southern Hemisphere?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: March

questions.question: What was the name of Americas first urban freeway?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Davison

questions.question: In what autumn movie can you see Richard Gere and Winona Ryder walking through a beautiful fall foliage?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Autumn In New York

questions.question: Detroit was a stop on the Underground Railroad.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Detroit is north of Canada.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the name of the popular harvest festival celebrated in China close to the autumnal equinox?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moon Festival

questions.question: The national flag of what country consists of three horizontal bands in red, black and white?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yemen

questions.question: What famous TV character spoke the words, There is a time of year in New York when, even before the first leaf falls, you can feel the seasons click. The air is crisp, the summer is gone. And for the first night in a long time, you need a blanket on your bed.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carrie Bradshaw (Sex and the City)

questions.question: Which of these birds do NOT migrate in autumn?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ravens

questions.question: Which two Great Lakes are connected by the Detroit River?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Huron and Erie

questions.question: What term refers to the full moon closest to the autumnal equinox?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harvest Moon

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Ohio and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, bird, presidents. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The national flag of what country consists of a smaller white area and a larger purple section?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Qatar

questions.question: What countrys national flag simply consists of  a blue and a yellow horizontal bands?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ukraine

questions.question: In which city is Ohio University located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Athens

questions.question: How many U.S. Presidents of the 19th and 20th century were born in Ohio?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 7

questions.question: What tree is depicted on the national flag of Lebanon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cedar

questions.question: Which of the two teams, established in Ohio in the 20th century, joined the NFL earlier?

options.text: They joined the NFL in the same year.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Cleveland Browns

questions.question: What is the state bird of Ohio?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cardinal

questions.question: What is Ohios nickname?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buckeye State

questions.question: The flag of what country is a red rectangle with a white crescent moon and a star in the center?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Turkey

questions.question: What country has a red flag with a stylized eight-rayed yellow sun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Macedonia

questions.question: How many red crosses are present on the national flag of Georgia, a country in the Caucasus region?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Five

questions.question: What is the capital of Ohio?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Columbus

questions.question: When did Ohio become a state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: March 1, 1803

questions.question: The national flag of Sri Lanka features a lion holding a sword. What does the curly mane of the lion represent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What are the colors on the national flag of Somalia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White and blue

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Capital and Region
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, reptile, spicy. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This autonomous region is located in the Horn of Africa and is part of the Somali Republic.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Somaliland

questions.question: This nearly submerged continent or microcontinent, also known as Tasmantis, sank after breaking away from Antarctica between 85 and 130 million years ago.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zealandia

questions.question: How many states border Ohio?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5

questions.question: This supercontinent broke up into two continents, then into the seven continents existing today.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pangea

questions.question: What two countries reunited in 1976 to form Vietnam?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South and North Vietnam

questions.question: Pristina is the capital of this country which gained its independence from Serbia on February 17 2008.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kosovo

questions.question: A small portion of this underwater volcanic region breaks sea level, forming the Kerguelen Islands, Heard Island and the McDonald Islands.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kerguelen Plateau

questions.question: Which U.S. state was nicknamed Americas Dairyland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wisconsin

questions.question: This small country in Southeast Asia, also known as Timor-Leste, is located about 640 km (400 mi) northwest of Darwin, Australia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: East Timor

questions.question: What interesting reptile nickname has been given to the U.S. state of Alabama?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lizard State

questions.question: This spicy nickname has been given to the U.S. state of Connecticut.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nutmeg State

questions.question: South Galcayo is the administrative capital of this secular, decentralized state in the central region of Somalia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Galdumug

questions.question: In 1990 these two countries reunited to form Germany.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: East and West Germany

questions.question: Garowe is the capital of this region in northeastern Somalia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Puntland

questions.question: The name Ohio is derived from an Iroquois Indian word meaning what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Large River

quizzes.title: History Quiz: U.s. State and Nicaraguas
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, nicknames, nicaraguas. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What interesting nickname was coined for the U.S. state of Missouri?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Show-Me State

questions.question: Which of these is one of the nicknames of he U.S. state of Arizona?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Italy of America

questions.question: What Nicaraguan lake covers an amazing area of 3,255 square miles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lake Nicaragua

questions.question: Which historical figure became dictator of Nicaraguas government in 1937?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anastasio Somoza Garcia

questions.question: What fruity nickname has been given to the U.S. state of Hawaii?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pineapple State

questions.question: Which of the following is not  an actual city in Nicaragua?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tegucigalpa

questions.question: Which U.S. state has been nicknamed The Peace Garden State?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North Dakota

questions.question: Known as the Father of Modernism, he is perhaps the most influential Nicaraguan poet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ruben Dario

questions.question: Which of the following is one of Nicaraguas boxing world champions?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alexis Arguello

questions.question: Nicaraguas folk music predominantly implements this musical instrument.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marimba

questions.question: This sporty nickname is used to refer to the U.S. state of Minnesota.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: State of Hockey

questions.question: What interesting nickname was given to the U.S. state of Delaware?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Uncle Sams Pocket Handkerchief

questions.question: What U.S. state is nicknamed The Volunteer State?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tennessee

questions.question: This shape is enclosed in Nicaraguas flag.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Triangle

questions.question: What is Nicaraguas official currency?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gold Cordoba

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Harvard and Graduate
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, college, unabomber. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This multi-Emmy-winning composer, famous for the musical West Side Story, studied music at Harvard.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leonard Bernstein

questions.question: Where is Vern Sneiders 1951 novel The Teahouse of the August Moon set?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Okinawa

questions.question: In 1988, this Harvard graduate became the first female Prime Minister of her country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Benazir Bhutto (Pakistan)

questions.question: What statement is true about Augustus after whom the month of August is named?

options.text: He was the last Emperor of the Roman Empire.
He was the fist Emperor of the Roman Empire.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was the fist Emperor of the Roman Empire.

questions.question: Grammy Award-winning guitarist and Harvard graduate Tom Morello is a founding member of this band.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rage Against the Machine

questions.question: The month of August was originally named Sextilis in Latin. What does sextilis mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: sixth

questions.question: Harvard graduate Al Gore, who served as the 45th Vice President of the US, is a recipient of which of the following awards?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: all of these

questions.question: This Israeli American actress, who graduated from Harvard College with a bachelors degree in psychology, became popular when she was cast in the Star Wars prequel trilogy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Natalie Portman

questions.question: Lammas Day used to be observed in some English-speaking countries on 1 August. What was brought to church on that day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a loaf of bread

questions.question: The San Cristobal, Concepcion, and El Chonco are all names of this geographic formation in Nicaragua.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Volcano

questions.question: Which Harvard graduate is not correctly matched with the literary work he created?

options.text: Norman Mailer - The Naked and the Dead

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Updike - Look Homeward, Angel

questions.question: This author, who graduated from Harvard summa cum laude in 1954, received the Pulitzer Prize for two of his Rabbit novels.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Updike

questions.question: A building on the Harvard campus is named after this 19th century philosopher, author and leader of the Transcendentalist movement.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ralph Waldo Emerson

questions.question: This virtuoso cellist, who received his bachelors degree from Harvard in 1976, performed for President John F. Kennedy when he was seven.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yo-Yo Ma

questions.question: This Harvard graduate, also known as the Unabomber, carried out a campaign of mail bombings.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ted Kaczynski

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: California and August
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, earthquakes, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What WWII event that occurred on 6 August 1945 was code-named Little Boy?

options.text: the dropping of the atomic bomb on Hiroshima
the dropping of the atomic bomb on Nagasaki

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the dropping of the atomic bomb on Hiroshima

questions.question: According to a popular weather saying, what will the winter be like if the first week of August is unusually warm?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: snowy and long

questions.question: What Nobel Prize and Pulitzer Prize-winning American author wrote the 1932 novel Light in August?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Faulkner

questions.question: What Protestant Christian church, located in South Los Angeles, is known for its celebrity members, which include Magic Johnson, Denzel Washington, and Stevie Wonder?

options.text: West Angeles Church of God in Christ

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: West Angeles Church of God in Christ

questions.question: Which of these US states is larger than California in terms of area?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Texas

questions.question: Im as corny as Kansas in August is a line from the song Im in Love with a Wonderful Guy, which was performed in what Rodgers and Hammerstein musical?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Pacific

questions.question: In what county is the city of Pasadena?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Los Angeles

questions.question: What year did Disneyland open?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1955

questions.question: This mountain, located in Siskiyou County, is the fifth highest in California.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mount Shasta

questions.question: In what California city is Knotts Berry Farm located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buena Park

questions.question: What are the sate colors of California?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: blue and gold

questions.question: Which of these internationally famous festivals takes place in August?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Edinburgh Festival

questions.question: The Gulf of Tonkin Incident, which occurred on August 2, prompted the first large-scale involvement of U.S. armed forces in this war.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vietnam War

questions.question: What California city is subject to earthquakes due to its location in the Pacific Ring of Fire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Los Angeles

questions.question: Which of the following is in the center of Californias state flag?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a bear
